intro: Lasiosiphon pulchellus var. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glory plants, and is characterized by its climbing habit and tubular flowers. The plant features hairy stems that become smooth as it matures, giving it its varietal name "glabratus." Its flowers are typically pale blue to violet in color and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
